channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [GROOVY-2901] Deadlock in GroovyClassLoader, ver. 1.5.6
item.description:
A deadlock can be created by two separate threads attempting to load classes from the same GroovyClassLoader. Reproducibility is non-deterministic as it seems to be a timing issue. The environment that produced the example stack trace below has the following features:

One thread is inside a call to groovyClassLoader.loadClass(scriptName, true, true);
One thread is inside a call to newInstance() on a Class returned by the previous call (on the same GroovyClassLoader)

Two different loaded scripts are involved in the two calls. Both scripts import other scripts (and therefore rely on the classloader to do recursive loading), though it's not clear whether that is an essential feature in causing the deadlock.

A straightforward solution might be to have the classCache calls (getClassCacheEntry, etc) synchronize on something else (like the cache itself) other than the loader, though it's not clear whether that would solve only this case or the general case.

Stacktraces:

Found one Java-level deadlock:
=============================
"resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-17":
waiting to lock monitor 0x080cff84 (object 0x4686f850, a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader),
which is held by "resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-1"

"resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-1":
waiting to lock monitor 0x080d0240 (object 0x4578aec0, a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader$InnerLoader),
which is held by "resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-17"

Java stack information for the threads listed above:
===================================================
"resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-17":
at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.getClassCacheEntry(GroovyClassLoader.java:514)

  • waiting to lock <0x4686f850> (a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:620)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader$InnerLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:385)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:723)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)
  • locked <0x4578aec0> (a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader$InnerLoader)
    at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
    at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:2389)
    at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:2699)
    at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:326)
    at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:308)
    ...

"resin-tcp-connection-*:8080-1":
at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredFields(Class.java:2291)
at java.lang.Class.privateGetPublicFields(Class.java:2324)
at java.lang.Class.getFields(Class.java:1359)
at org.codehaus.groovy.classgen.Verifier.getTimestamp(Verifier.java:606)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.getTimeStamp(ResolveVisitor.java:185)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.isSourceNewer(ResolveVisitor.java:205)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.resolveToScript(ResolveVisitor.java:234)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.resolve(ResolveVisitor.java:162)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.resolveFromModule(ResolveVisitor.java:388)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.resolve(ResolveVisitor.java:162)

at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transformVariableExpression(ResolveVisitor.java:565)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transform(ResolveVisitor.java:440)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transformPropertyExpression(ResolveVisitor.java:532)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transform(ResolveVisitor.java:442)
at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.expr.Expression.transformExpressions(Expression.java:49)
at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.expr.ArgumentListExpression.transformExpression(ArgumentListExpression.java:67)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transform(ResolveVisitor.java:457)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transformMethodCallExpression(ResolveVisitor.java:635)
at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transform(ResolveVisitor.java:448)

at org.codehaus.groovy.control.ResolveVisitor.transform(ResolveVisitor.java:446)
at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeExpressionTransformer.visitExpressionStatement(ClassCodeExpressionTransformer.java:148)

at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitClassCodeContainer(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:73)
at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitConstructorOrMethod(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:80)
at org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeExpressionTransformer.visitConstructorOrMethod(ClassCodeExpressionTransformer.java:53)

at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:289)

  • locked <0x4686f850> (a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:260)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:255)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.recompile(GroovyClassLoader.java:708)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:668)
  • locked <0x4686f850> (a groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader)
    at groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:497)
    ...

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
We have encountered the same problem while using version of Groovy 1.5.6.

We believe that problem is exactly the same, so the problem hasn't been solved or there was regression since version 1.5.1.

Please look at the stacktraces of 2 threads causing the deadlock:

Thread 1: -----------------------------------------------------------------------
java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields0(Native Method)
java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredFields(Class.java:2291)
java.lang.Class.getDeclaredFields(Class.java:1743)
org.codehaus.groovy.vmplugin.v5.Java5.configureClassNode(Java5.java:154)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.lazyClassInit(ClassNode.java:209)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.getUnresolvedSuperClass(ClassNode.java:744)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.getUnresolvedSuperClass(ClassNode.java:738)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.getSuperClass(ClassNode.java:732)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.isDerivedFrom(ClassNode.java:681)
org.codehaus.groovy.classgen.ClassCompletionVerifier.visitCatchStatement(ClassCompletionVerifier.java:324)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.stmt.CatchStatement.visit(CatchStatement.java:40)

org.codehaus.groovy.ast.CodeVisitorSupport.visitBlockStatement(CodeVisitorSupport.java:37)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitBlockStatement(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:129)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.stmt.BlockStatement.visit(BlockStatement.java:52)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitClassCodeContainer(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:73)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitConstructorOrMethod(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:80)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitMethod(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:88)
org.codehaus.groovy.classgen.ClassCompletionVerifier.visitMethod(ClassCompletionVerifier.java:236)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassNode.visitContents(ClassNode.java:822)
org.codehaus.groovy.ast.ClassCodeVisitorSupport.visitClass(ClassCodeVisitorSupport.java:48)
org.codehaus.groovy.classgen.ClassCompletionVerifier.visitClass(ClassCompletionVerifier.java:59)
org.codehaus.groovy.control.CompilationUnit$10.call(CompilationUnit.java:666)
org.codehaus.groovy.control.CompilationUnit.applyToPrimaryClassNodes(CompilationUnit.java:885)
org.codehaus.groovy.control.CompilationUnit.compile(CompilationUnit.java:436)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:277)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:248)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.parseClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:243)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.recompile(GroovyClassLoader.java:703)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:663)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:718)
palio.compiler.groovy.GroovyEngine$MyGroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyEngine.java:40)
palio.compiler.groovy.GroovyEngine.getCompiledClass(GroovyEngine.java:166)
palio.pelements.PObject.getGroovyClass(PObject.java:168)
palio.pelements.PObject.execute(PObject.java:113)

Thread 2: -----------------------------------------------------------------------
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:295)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:633)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader$InnerLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:375)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:718)
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319)
java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:2389)
java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:2699)
java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:326)
java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:308)
palio.pelements.PObject.execute(PObject.java:113)

too bad that I have no simple example to reproduce this and no locking information in the 1.5.6 trace. Anyway I will try to find the locks...

first in Thread 2:

java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) is synchronized on this. Since we call it on a newly loaded class from GCl I suspect the lock is on GroovyClassLoader$InnerLoader. Bw, loadClassInternal is a private method in ClassLoader, so there is no way for us to avoid that lock.

java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:295)
groovy.lang.GroovyClassLoader.loadClass(GroovyClassLoader.java:633)
this causes another synchronization, but this time on "this" is GroovyClassLoader.

what you see in thread 2 is not the compilation of depending classes, instead the class itself gets initialized, which causes further class loading. Usually the classes are already available, because you just compiled them. So what is in line 633? In this line the parent loader should be asked, which is done by calling the original loadClass method.

Now while compiling one or more classes we need to lock too, since the compiler is not thread safe. If we lock on "this", then it is GCL again. That means we have two places that need to acquire a lock on "this" and since the compilation can take a while it is likely that a loadClass call has to wait. Now it is also possible that while compiling a class might get intialized. Since normally InnerLoader is the ClassLoader for classes compiled this way a trace like in Thread1 would be caused. So one thread awaits the complition of the compilation, while another thread needs to load classes through the locked class loader.

Since I can not do anything against loadClassInternal to acquire that lock I naturally would have to avoid locking "this" while the compilation happens. If the compiler find he needs to compile yet another file, then he will not use GCL to start yet another compilation.

Yes, I think if the compilation has its own lock, then all should get well. So I made a change to giv the compilation part its own lock. A class loading caused by loadClassInternal does normally not cause any recompilation. Then it is possible for GCL#loadClass to only get a lock on "this" once, when it calls super.loadClass.

Since you can so easily reproduce the issue it would be nice of you to grab the newest 1.6 or 1.5 and test if the issue is still there.

We'are sorry but we cannot reproduce the issue anymore. We'had made effort to minimalize number of processed recompilations and issue didn't show up recently.
Unfortunately, we cannot go back to our earlier code with new version of Groovy, that was causing the deadlock, because this is very important to us production environment.

Anyway, We hope that the problem was permanently solved. Thank you for your quick response.
